titleInfo.title: DISAPPROVING DEPARTMENT OF LABOR RULE RELATED TO DEFINITION OF THE TERM ``FIDUCIARY''--VETO MESSAGE FROM THE PRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES

name.namePart: Committee on Education and the Workforce

extension.searchTitle: DISAPPROVING DEPARTMENT OF LABOR RULE RELATED TO DEFINITION OF THE TERM ``FIDUCIARY''--VETO MESSAGE FROM THE PRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES; Congressional Record Vol. 162, No. 100

congVote.result: So the previous question was ordered.
congVote.dailyDigestCategory1: Disapproving the rule submitted by the Department of Labor relating to the definition of the term ``Fiduciary''_Presidential Veto
congVote.dailyDigestSummary: The House voted to sustain the President's veto of H.J. Res. 88, disapproving the rule submitted by the Department of Labor relating to the definition of the term ``Fiduciary'', by a yea-and-nay vote of 239 yeas to 180 nays, Roll No. 338 (two-thirds of those present not voting to override), after the previous question was ordered by a recorded vote of 229 ayes to 175 noes with two answering ``present'', Roll No. 337.

congVote.result: So (two-thirds not being in the affirmative) the veto of the President was sustained and the joint resolution was rejected.
congVote.dailyDigestCategory1: Disapproving the rule submitted by the Department of Labor relating to the definition of the term ``Fiduciary''_Presidential Veto
congVote.dailyDigestSummary: The House voted to sustain the President's veto of H.J. Res. 88, disapproving the rule submitted by the Department of Labor relating to the definition of the term ``Fiduciary'', by a yea-and-nay vote of 239 yeas to 180 nays, Roll No. 338 (two-thirds of those present not voting to override), after the previous question was ordered by a recorded vote of 229 ayes to 175 noes with two answering ``present'', Roll No. 337.

titleInfo.title: HOUR OF MEETING ON THURSDAY, JUNE 23, 2016

extension.searchTitle: HOUR OF MEETING ON THURSDAY, JUNE 23, 2016; Congressional Record Vol. 162, No. 100

congVote.result: So the motion to fix next convening time was agreed to.
congVote.dailyDigestCategory1: Motion to Fix Next Convening Time
congVote.dailyDigestSummary: Agreed to the Sessions motion that when the House adjourns on the legislative day of Wednesday, June 22, 2016, it adjourn to meet at 2:30 a.m. on Thursday, June 23, 2016, by a recorded vote of 234 ayes to 166 noes, Roll No. 339.

extension.searchTitle: MOTION TO ADJOURN; Congressional Record Vol. 162, No. 100

congVote.result: So the motion to adjourn was agreed to.
congVote.dailyDigestSummary: Agreed to the Sessions motion to adjourn by a recorded vote of 234 ayes to 173 noes, Roll No. 340.
